isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - 12/06/1994 and After - SERVICE WITH R-134A PROCEDURES

svcproc.title: SERVICE WITH R-134A PROCEDURES
svcproc.para: Special attention to the following during component remove and install will aid in avoiding unnecessary and time-consuming problems.

step1.para: Note cable routings during removal. Where necessary, cables should make sweeping curves. Sharp bends tend to increase resistance to bowden wire movement and sometimes cause kinks, which render the cable inoperative.

It is most important that all refrigerant O-rings and tubing fittings be lubricated with MINERAL-BASED refrigerant oil and tightened as specified in the TORQUE CHART. Always use a back-up wrench when loosening or tightening fittings.

important.para: Use mineral-based oil to lubricate O-rings and fittings. Do not use PAG or ESTER oils as they absorb moisture and will cause fittings to corrode and become difficult to disassemble.

step1.para: Replace the receiver-dehydrator unit on any system which is opened for more than a very short period, when the system is flushed, and/or when the compressor is replaced.

Be certain that the evaporator core temperature control sensing capillary tube is properly inserted into the evaporator core. When re-installing, do not put in the same opening that it was removed from.
All refrigerant hose and tubing support clamps and strap locks must be re-installed in their original positions.

The air conditioning system must be flushed as described in GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE with R-134a section in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual anytime the compressor is replaced.
The compressor oil level must be checked and replaced as specified in GROUP 16 - COMPRESSOR in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

The type of refrigerant oil used in R-134a charged systems has been changed to a non-mineral based oil. The following information must be adhered to when servicing the air conditioning system in these vehicles.

important.para: These model vehicles built between January 1, 1993, and February 1, 1995, had the compressor filled with PAG oil. Effective approximately February 1, 1995, all refrigerant compressors are filled with Lubrizol LZ2916 Ester Oil.

step1.para: If it is necessary to add oil when servicing the air conditioning system and the system is filled with PAG oil, it is recommended that the PAG oil be drained out of the compressor and replaced with Lubrizol LZ2916 Ester oil. Check the label on the compressor to verify the type of oil in the A/C system.

All refrigerant hose and tubing openings should be immediately covered or plugged during removal and remain so until re-installation to prevent the entry of dirt, moisture and other foreign material. Even the slightest particle can cause problems if carried in the system to the right place.
